resources.string: You might need to accept a prompt on the other device if you are trying to connect to it for the first time from this device
You are using the latest version
Pure black theme for devices with OLED panel
aShell You is here for all your ADB needs
App is updated, want to see changelogs?
aShell You is still working. Please wait for it to finish or manually stop (by clicking the stop button) to run a new command
This feature is currently in its experimental phase. If you encounter any issues please let us know.
Maximum bookmark limit reached! Delete some bookmarks to add new ones
Are you sure you want to clear everything on this screen?
Selected %d items will be added to bookmarks
Selected %d items will be removed from bookmarks
Warning ! This action is irreversible\nAre you sure you want to delete all bookmarks?
All unpinned commands will be pinned\nDo you wish to continue?
\[%s\] will be pinned\nDo you wish to continue?
Do you want to unpin the selected commands?
\[%s\] will be unpinned\nDo you wish to continue?
Choose the default working mode for running ADB commands
Failed to generate and save key pair
No application found to perform the task
No command found that matches your query
Device is not properly connected. Connect the device properly through OTG and try again
aShell You is still working. Do you want to stop the current process?
Do you want to quit aShell You?
If enabled then sharing any text to aShell You automatically runs the shell with the shared text as input
The output of last command is not saved
The output of last command is exported to \'%s\' folder
The shell output is exported to \'%s\' folder
Access to Shizuku service is denied for aShell You. aShell You won\'t work without a proper Shizuku environment.
Shizuku is not installed or not properly configured on your device. aShell You won\'t work without a proper Shizuku environment.
aShell You is not designed for root-related uses. Aborting.
All info cards will be visible now
A newer version of aShell You is available !\nClick on Download button to get the new version from the repository
You need to turn on USB Debugging in the developer settings of the target device
Choose what portion of the shell output should be saved
Enables smooth scrolling in the shell output when top or bottom arrow is clicked
If enabled a confirmation popup will show after you click the Clear screen button
Automatically checks for available newer versions when the app launches
Might cause lag if a large number of bookmarks are added! Low end devices should keep this option turned off
Useful when you want to use an external keyboard
All information cards will be visible again
History of all the changes made to the app
Just a guy who loves apps and design
Developer of Shizuku\nThe main functionality provider of aShell You
Developer of aShell\nWithout him aShell You wouldn\'t exist
Developer of ADB‚ö°OTG\nThanks to him OTG feature could be implemented in aShell You
The best guy in the world has been an incredible help. Without him, aShell wouldn\'t be here. Thanks a ton for your support, buddy!
Developer of Iconify\nHelped me fix issues in aShell You ü§ù
A freelancer translator who did the Portuguese translations
The guy who did the Chinese translations
Turkese translations are done by him
Report any issue you have faced while using the app
If you have any ideas or suggestions in your mind , let us know
Visit the github repository of aShell You
Join the telegram channel for discussion
Learn about the license this app is using
Kill all background processes associated with a given package
Kill all processes that are safe to kill (cached, etc)
Display the contents of a text file
Shows disk usage in human readable form
Change the level to unknown, charging, discharging, not charging or full
Go to the top of the shell output (fun command)
Go to the bottom of the shell output (fun command)
Search file(s) for lines that match a given pattern
Kill a process by specifying its PID
Display real-time log of system messages
Sets the buffer size (K or M)
Delete all data associated with an app
Only clear cache data associated with an app
Only delete the data associated with a given user
Disable a given package or component (written as package or class
Disable an app for a given user
Enable a given package or component (written as package or class
Grant a permission to an app
Allow version code downgrade (debuggable packages only)
Specify package name of installer owning the app
Partial application install (new split on top of existing pkg)
Update an existing apps, but disallow replacement of existing one
Override the default ABI of the platform
Install a new feature split without killing the running app
Cause the app to be installed as a non-ephemeral full app
Force the install location (Options, 0=auto, 1=internal only, 2=prefer external)
Indicates why the app is being installed (Options, 0=unknown, 1=admin policy, 2=device restore,3=device setup, 4=user request)
Cause the app to be installed as an ephemeral install app
Don\'t whitelist restricted permissions at install
Specify expected package name of app being installed
Delete the given active install session
Commit the given active install session, installing the app
Installs an existing application for a new user
Wait until the package is installed
Mark SPLIT(s) as removed in the given install session
Write an apk into the given install session
List all known packages, but excluding APEXes
List package names along with their associated file
List package names along with their installer
List package names along with their version code
List package names of all apps including the uninstalled ones
List package names along with their package UID
Print all information about the known permissions
Organize all known permission by group
Print a short summary about the known permissions
Print only permissions that users will see
Show apk file path of an app
Revoke a permission from an app
Suspend an app. You won\'t be able to use a suspended app until you unsuspend it
Uninstall an app but keep the data and cache untouched
Uninstall an app from a given user
Only uninstall if the app has the given version code
Removes updates to a given system application and falls back to its system version
Synchronize data on disk with memory
List processes running on the system
Update display n times, then exit
Print the current user id and name

‚Ä¢ Added option to open saved output directly

‚Ä¢ Added option to save whole output or the last command output only

‚Ä¢ Fixed crashes

‚Ä¢ Fixed an issue with Sharing text to aShell You where the text did not appear when app was starting fresh

‚Ä¢ Fixed minor UI issues

‚Ä¢ Stable release of OTG mode

‚Ä¢ Added features like save, share, quick scroll buttons to the OTG mode

‚Ä¢ Added info cards for quick information

‚Ä¢ Added in app update checker along with the option to auto check for updates

‚Ä¢ Minor UI improvements

‚Ä¢ Fixed some issues in OTG adb support

‚Ä¢ Updated translations

‚Ä¢ Updated dependencies

‚Ä¢ Added more command examples
\n\n‚Ä¢ Fixed AMOLED theme not working on devices running Android 11 or below

‚Ä¢ Now you can Pin commands for quick access

 ‚Ä¢ Bug fixes and lot of code optimisations

‚Ä¢ Now you can directly use commands from the Commands section instead of the need to copy them every time

 ‚Ä¢ Added option to delete all bookmarks

‚Ä¢ In search : You can now search in commands summary by clicking a prompt chip

‚Ä¢ Added sorting options in Commands templates

‚Ä¢ Added option to directly bookmark selected items in Commands section

‚Ä¢ Chip Indicator shows connected device(currently only in local ADB mode)

‚Ä¢ Fixed bugs causing crashes in devices running Android 11 or below

‚Ä¢ Added Turkish translation

‚Ä¢ Minor UI improvements

‚Ä¢ Lot of other bug fixes

‚Ä¢ Added total bookmarks count

‚Ä¢ Fixed some bugs

‚Ä¢ Added Search in commands section

‚Ä¢ Added option to set default working mode

‚Ä¢ Improved animations

‚Ä¢ Reworked bookmarks section and added sorting options

‚Ä¢ Increased bookmarks limit to 25

‚Ä¢ Removed ADB shell launcher shortcut and added Commands launcher shortcut

‚Ä¢ Fixed padding issues in button navigation

‚Ä¢ Fixed some buttons shape

‚Ä¢ App uses a more refreshed color palette for material you themeing

‚Ä¢ Fixed minor bugs
\n\n‚Ä¢ Fixed some crashes that were introduced in v3.8.0

‚Ä¢ Added black (amoled) theme

‚Ä¢ Added undo button to undo paste

‚Ä¢ Added option to disable soft keyboard

‚Ä¢ Fixed buttons stretched in some screen sizes

‚Ä¢ Fixed bookmarks button not appearing after opening the app

‚Ä¢ Renamed Examples section to Commands

‚Ä¢ Fixed copy command option not appearing for every command template

‚Ä¢ App now uses system font everywhere

‚Ä¢ Improved UI handling

‚Ä¢ Updated translations

‚Ä¢ Now you can share texts from anywhere on your device to aShell You and run commands directly.

‚Ä¢ Now you can share shell output directly without needing to save it !

‚Ä¢ A lot of optimisations and UI handling.

‚Ä¢ Added Chinese translations.

‚Ä¢ Updated translations.

‚Ä¢ Added option to clear the command input field after an error

‚Ä¢ Fixed a bug which caused the app to crash upon pasting from clipboard under certain conditions

‚Ä¢ Code optimisations
\n\n‚Ä¢ Fixed some issues with bottom navigation.

‚Ä¢ Revamped About section of the app.

‚Ä¢ Added launcher shortcuts.

‚Ä¢ Fixed navigation menu not showing in button navigation.

‚Ä¢ Improved bottom navigation menu visibility on scrolling.

‚Ä¢ Added per app language support for aShell You (translations aren't completed yet).

‚Ä¢ A lot of code optimisations.

‚Ä¢ Added a Paste button so that you can copy and paste commands quickly.

‚Ä¢ Added Error indicators in the text input field.

‚Ä¢ Improved Navigation Bar visibility logic.

‚Ä¢ Fixed an issue where switches misbehaves under certain situations.

‚Ä¢ Fixed add bookmark icon visibility in various contrast levels.

‚Ä¢ A lot of code optimisation. App now opens a lot faster than before.

‚Ä¢ App will stay in background and won't restart every time you close the app by just pressing the back button or gesture.

‚Ä¢ Added bookmarks , history and command suggestions to OTG

‚Ä¢ Added maximum bookmarks limit.

‚Ä¢ Added option to override maximum bookmarks limit.

‚Ä¢ A lot of bug fixes.

‚Ä¢ Improved some UI handling.

‚Ä¢ A lot of code optimisation.

‚Ä¢ A lot of UI related improvements.

‚Ä¢ Added chips that indicate current ADB working mode.

‚Ä¢ A lot of code optimisation.

‚Ä¢ Improvements to ADB OTG after initial release.

‚Ä¢ Some UI and logic adjustments to accomodate the new otg feature.

‚Ä¢ Added ADB THROUGH OTG support.

 *** You will be able to run ADB commands on other devices using aShellYou by connecting the other device using an OTG cable ***

‚Ä¢ Removed unnecessary code and resources.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Removed unnecessary code and resources.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Changed app name to aShell You.

‚Ä¢ Added predictive back animations for supporting devices.

‚Ä¢ Added confirmation dialog popup before clearing screen.

‚Ä¢ Fixed StatusBar elements not properly visible in Light mode.

‚Ä¢ App is much more smooth now.
 ~ Reduced app size and optimised code.

‚Ä¢ Added themed icon for launchers that support themed icons.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Revamped Settings panel.

‚Ä¢ Added Double Tap to instant scroll to top and bottom positions in shell output view.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI fixes.

‚Ä¢ Added Settings panel.

‚Ä¢ Added option to disable smooth scroll in shell output.

‚Ä¢ Fixed major bugs:

 ~ Crash while changing device theme.

 ~ Crash while trying to save large shell output . eg : output of 'pm' command.

‚Ä¢ Replaced some deprecated api.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Added Scroll To Top and Scroll To Bottom buttons.

‚Ä¢ Added Click keyboard Enter key to Send command.

‚Ä¢ Added some commands.

‚Ä¢ Updated dependencies to include latest material you library.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Added some more command examples.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Changed package name to avoid version confusion with original app.

‚Ä¢ Added changelogs into the app.

‚Ä¢ Added highlighted shell output.

‚Ä¢ Minor UI changes.

‚Ä¢ Added dynamic material theming.

‚Ä¢ Revamped whole UI to give a fresh look.
